content.description: Great OW route with interesting moves to keep you from falling out of the crack. If you can't find em', keep digging for those great fist jams, they are there. If you start falling out, turn that foot!
content.protection: SR to 6. Bolted anchors at top that share with "Flying Dog". You can top rope this route but beware a big swing if you should fall out the crack
content.location: Left of "Flying Dog" on Dead Dog Wall, the obvious dihedral crack. Start in the chimney and good luck! Rap down or top out.

content.description: Climb juggy yet questionable rock to loose plates and a horizontal crack below the lip of an overhang with a nice hand crack lingering above. Place strenuous pro in the horizontal and make the move pulling over the lip into the crack. You reach a ledge with an overhanging 2nd crux at the top. Nest some extended gear and go for it.
content.protection: SR. Tree.
content.location: Between Energemata and Inherit the Wind, Directly across from Black Narcissus.

content.description: Climb decent rock in a crack to the roof.  Pull the roof and continue on much better rock in a crack to the top.
content.protection: 1 bolt (in 2005), gear to 3 or 3.5".  2 bolt anchor, if I remember right.  If not, use trees.
content.location: On the right end of the Too Big to Finger Walls, this is a slightly overhanging dihedral system with a small roof 1/3 of the way up.  The route begins right at a small cave which usually has a pool of water coming out of it.

content.description: A fun line up an attractive arète. Start in a clean casual dihedral and step left towards the first bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Optional cams for fifth class start (15 feet, casual)
content.location: The arete to the right of “Back Rub” which makes the southern (valley) facing wall of the catacombs. Around the corner left of Dead Dog.

climbs.name: Second Adam
climbs.fa: Clay Frisbie, Chuck Caughlin, Tom Hancock 1994

content.description:
A thought provoking two pitch line that follows the jug lined arete up through a massive overhang. P1 (5.12a): A short pitch that can be approached two ways. The direct start below the jugs is powerful and recommended. Alternatively, starting left of the arete in the shallow dihedral presents an awkward crunchy sequence that traverses right towards the arete. Once on the arete, enjoy a short section of jugs and top out on the ledge at a two bolt anchor. 5 bolts, bolt anchor.

 P2 (5.11a): Follow the dihedral upwards past a pin beneath the huge roof. Hand traverse to your right past a bolt and pull the exposed lip protected by the second and last bolt. Follow an easy crack system up and right to a bolt anchor.
content.protection: P1: 5 bolts, bolt anchor   P2: SR, 2 bolts, fixed pin, bolt anchor
content.location: From Dead Dog, walk east around the corner and encounter a huge roof. You can find the start  by locating the shallow dihedral below a huge hueco.

content.description: Interesting 11+/12- climbing brings you to a dynamic crux above the 4th bolt. Punch it through a slight runout on moderate terrain to a rest before the crux. Hard moves right off the rest slowly ease off to the anchors. A fixed draw has been added on the 5th bolt so that it is possible to clip it off the jug, otherwise it is scary to hang a draw. It can also be used for cleaning.
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: Right of Second Adam

content.description: This is the hand and finger crack line on the left side of the alcove.  It pulls over a bulge about 10 feet up and continues in the crack to the top, ending at the small pine tree.  The bolts are just up and left of the tree.
content.protection: Gear to 3".  2 bolt anchor with rap rings.
content.location: This route is in the alcove right around the corner from Dead Dog and Whiff of a Dead Dog, which are just right of the Catacombs Walkdown.

content.description: A fun and I'd imagine often-overlooked route. Start on the Sam's Special choss then work good holds through the steep. Make desperate moves to gain the face then clip the 4th and surprisingly final bolt. The hard part's over but don't pump off those chickenheads as you run it out to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts, links on the anchors. Optional small cams for the crack and/or slings for chickenheads.
content.location: From the Catacombs, hike past the corner of Dead Dog. Perelandra stands alone just before the big amphitheater of Second Adam. Look for the bolted thin crack.

content.description: Either grovel through an easy flare or climb low angle crimps to the pod below the first large overhang. Using jugs work up and then out to the lip on the first overhang on mostly good holds, turning the first roof into a good stance. Scramble up underneath the splitter offwidth/squeeze looming above. Work available feet, sparse hands, and a chicken-wing to leverage to the edge of the crack. Pull the strenuous crux moves to surmount the squeeze and cruise moderate wideness to the top.
content.protection: SR. (2) #6, Big Bros or #7 Camalot. Slings. Gear Anchor.
content.location: This route is located right, around the corner from Green Eggs and Spam (10b) and left of Break in the Battle (11c).

content.description: Cruxy low moves will get you into a tight chimney.  Squirm past the large horizontal, up and out of the widening chimney, and onto the dirty slab at wall left to finish at the tree anchor.
content.protection: Big Bros and a large hand/fist sized cam; tree anchor
content.location: Obvious chimney just left of the Dunamis dihedral and to the right of Renewed Mind

content.description: Climb the sweet face, following the bolts.  After the bolts, climb the vertical crack, heading up and left to top out.  Great rock.
content.protection: 7 bolts. 2 bolt anchor. Rap or lower.
content.location: On the Fraggle Rock Wall, this is the orange face in the middle of the left wall.

content.description: A free variation of "Prince of Light"-A2 . Begin with Second Adam's first anchor, head up the stem box, then left out the roof on a good hand crack/rail until your feet are settled in the large hole. From here follow rails out the roof, clipping two bolts. Beware the hold at the lip. If it is wet; DON'T CLIMB IT!! It may break. A fun route with big air. A moderate final pitch goes directly up off a set of anchors.
content.protection: #4 Camalot, #.5 camalot, draws  +tcus and nuts for final pitch

content.description:
Adventurous climbing on steep angles.  

  Cruise up the easy start into some steep terrain where you make a big swing out a small roof. From here grab some wildly unique jugs and mantle onto a small ledge. 

  Fire up pumpy terrain into cruiser jugs up top. 

Rocks rather soft on this route in places.
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: To the right of "SAMCRO"

content.description: Enjoyable. Rock quality is good if you stay on route. Route name came from daughter's toothbrush used to clean out bolt holes.
content.protection: 5 bolts and anchor
content.location: East Bluff, 15 yards east of Swamp Thing. Start under a blunt steep arête, angles right.

climbs.name: Green Eggs and Spam
climbs.fa: Frisbie, Hancock, Murphy, Eric Massey, Kevin Hale  7/94

content.description: Climb the chimney to the base of the offwidth roof.  Pull through, remembering the wall behind you, on to easier terrain above.  Pulling another offwidth roof and slopey face gets you the the top of this big route.
content.protection: Gear to the biggest stuff they make.  Belay on trees and rap to the left on Inherit the Wind's bolts.
content.location: This is the huge chimney/offwidth on the left side of the offwidth buttress.  Also, it is right of the bolted Inherit the Wind.

content.description: Super fun. Technical crux above 4th bolt, followed by rest station and pump fest to the chains. Starting flakes are a little fragile, pull down, not out (Crux work-around to left not recommended, way off bolt line)
content.protection: 9 bolts to chains.
content.location: Frosted face to steep arête 15 feet right of Swamp Thing.

content.description: Stem a flaky, licheny, mossy start on a couple of okay holds and slopers through a thin crack that eventually becomes a hand crack. Works the short hand crack and wide stems out to the roof. Hit a fist jam or two along with okay jugs to transfer out onto the left face, using a couple pumpy moves the crux ends above the roof. From here a fun wide flare takes you to a good belay tree up top.
content.protection: SR to #5. Doubles of #.5 - #4. Tree anchor.
content.location: This is the roof crack just right of China Doll (10-) and left of Green Eggs and Spam (10b).

content.description:
Low crux on thin holds, make a few more hard moves on edges till it eases up the higher you move. 

  Superb moves on relatively beautiful sandstone
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: Left of "Dead Dog"

content.description: Climb the chimney, pulling left around the corner when you can.  Climb the handcrack over a bulge and top the top as it gets a little wider.  Good rock.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5".  Rap off trees or hike straight east across the large finger of rock to the bolts at the top of Inherit the Wind.
content.location: At the right end of the Dead Dog Wall area.  Left around the corner from the Fraggle Rock Wall, there is a cavelike area with a overhanging fistcrack in the back of it.  Just right of that is this climb, starting in a chimney.

content.description: Get established in the base of the flaring corner crack and struggle through a couple off-width/chimney moves before being relieved of duty by an abundance of face holds on either side. Alternatively, stem.
content.protection: A couple pieces each of the #2 and #3 Camalots and a single #4. Tree anchor.
content.location: This is the main off-width corner in the center of the alcove, marked by a flaring base.

content.description:
Came across this route last weekend, no one seemed to know where it came from so posting to MtnProj to get more info happening! Bolts look fresh. First two bolts identified in pic, rest are guesstimates.  

 Scramble up to the ledge and pull on big jugs past the initial overhang onto a juggy face right of the arete. Work your way up on positive holds to the tiny roof where you'll find the crux. Moving past the roof, balance up an easy slab section with positive holds to the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: First sport route right of Dead Dog.

content.description: One of the best sport climbs in the area comprising a slight overhang, smooth holds, continuous movement, a true top-out, a hint of a rest, and a touch of route finding in the form of hold selection. Pull up unto the orange band of rock, traverse right to the first bolt, and float endless crimps to the summit ledge.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a bolted anchor above the top-out ledge.
content.location: To the climber's right of the Catacombs approach, locate the beautiful, overhanging alligator skin above a low, wide cave and and a band of orange rock.

content.description: Climb the crack in the dihedral through decent rock.  Pull a roof on good rock and continue to the top out in the dihedral crack.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5 or 4".  Belay on trees.  Best to walk over to Inherit the Wind to rap.
content.location: On the Fraggle Rock Wall, this is the dihedral roof crack in the corner.

content.description: Awesome and unique chimney climbing for Arkansas! Climb the strenuous chimney to some good feet, where it eases up past the second bolt. From here follow two more bolts and wiggle through the body sized hole to the anchors. Adventurous for a sport climb!
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. Not equipped for lowering/rappelling.
content.location: While facing Whiff of a Dead Dog, walk into the large chimney to the right. Wiggle your way in about 15 feet or so and look for the bolts above.

climbs.name: Break in the Battle
climbs.fa: Clay Frisbie, Jon Von Canon, Tom Hancock, 1991

content.description: This double roof crack earns its name. Battle through a wide roof crack with deep jams. Take your break. Then finish the battle through another roof crack before the finish.
content.protection: 1 bolt, standard trad rack

content.description: Climb the easy, but slightly fragile start, to an interesting roof with big moves on more solid incuts and ledges. Finish at anchors just over the lip. This is a nice bouldery route and an easy warm-up for other 5.11s and 5.12s in the area.
content.protection: 4 bolts, all visible from the ground and chained anchors
content.location: Just to the right of Arkansas roofs 101 (trad crack) and just to the left of Hello Kitty (sport climb). There is usually a ticked "11" at the base.

content.description: Climb the fistcrack 20 feet to the base of the roof.  Climb through the roof using the crack and any holds around.  Continue in the crack to the top on less steep terrain.  Good 1st 10 trad lead at Sam's.  Good rock and pro.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5 or 4". Tree Anchor
content.location: At the right end of the Too Big to Finger Walls, this is right around the corner from Swamp Thing.  Begin in the crack leading to the roof crack 20 feet up.

content.description: Mixed styles of climbing on an east facing wall.
